intro: Calycadenia elegans, commonly known as the elegant globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open meadows and along streambanks. Calycadenia elegans is a perennial herb with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves.
